remarks.para: Left and Right ILS may be inoperative.
Left or Right ILS may be inoperative.
See MEL item 34-22-5-1 for other possible restrictions.

note.para: Should the center lLS power supply become inoperative or the center lLS circuit breaker is open en route (11A3), remaining operative lLS’ tuning must be verified by use of the HSI lLS mode frequency display. This is necessary since the center lLS provides power for the frequency display on the lLS panel.
For autoland conditions requiring LAND 2 ASA annunciation, at least 2 ILS receivers are required. The operative ILS receivers must be associated with the engaged autopilots.
For autoland conditions requiring LAND 3 ASA annunciation, 3 lLS receivers are required.
For an autopilot approach to Category 2 minima without autoland, at least 2 lLS receivers are required. The operative lLS receivers must be associated with the engaged autopilot(s).

numlitem.para: Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 3a with one ILS receiver inoperative or downgrade to CAT 1 with 2 ILS receivers inoperative.

placard.para: Placard ILS Control located near panel P8 "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
